overview:
Sam Bonfante is a partner and investor in various education and publishing projects.

Bonfante is a founding partner at Bonfante Group, a consulting firm that specializes in global brand management for universities and non-profit organizations. Prior to forming Bonfante Group, he was the Associate Publisher of The Chronicle of Higher Education and The Chronicle of Philanthropy where he managed the US and International University and Nonprofit Client Group.

Before The Chronicle, Bonfante served in a similar capacity for Education Week, the leading policy journal serving the United States K-12 education community. In his role at Education Week he worked closely with the Consortium of School Networking (CoSN) and the U.S. Department of Education’s technology initiative to assist Apple, Microsoft, HP, Pearson, Intel, Google and other high tech companies reach education policymakers on federal, state and local levels.

Through Bonfante Group he has acted as a strategic brand and management adviser to various organizations including education ministries, social media companies, publishers, foundations and universities.
